meanings.definition: Having made a valid will before death.
meanings.sent1: The testate individual ensured their wishes were clear in the will.
meanings.sent2: It is important to be testate to avoid confusion after passing away.
meanings.sent3: The testate cat left all its toys to the neighbor's dog in the will.
meanings.sent4: Her testate mind was like a well-organized library, with each book representing a different asset.
meanings.sent5: The testate tree bore fruits of inheritance, ripe for distribution among the family.

meanings.definition: A person who has made a valid will before death.
meanings.sent1: The testate left behind a detailed will for their loved ones.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer met with the testate to finalize the will.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, Bob dressed up as a testate, carrying a will as a prop.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the testate of the town, with her will being the talk of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The testate's legacy lived on through the carefully planned will they left behind.
